29. In Orlando Furioso, the Ferrarese Poet
of fine style tell his story in such a manner
that they seem to be painted,
enchanting his Reader as sweetly as
he describes Ruggiero [enchanted] by Alcina,
when, after a festive party,
she grandly led him into a bedchamber
to enjoy unfettered freedom with him.
left-middleExample from Ariosto in his Furioso, Canto 7.

30. The Pages proceeded with much Torchlight
to drive away the darkness;
accompanied with cheerful Personages,
Ruggiero went to find the soft featherbed
spread out there for his pleasure,
and sheets [perfumed] with rose-water,
of such fine white linen
that Arachne herself might have woven.

31. The raging flame from a fire (a terror
in Men’s hearts) when it flares up,
produces a fervid glitter with its sparks,
the heavier and thicker the dark sail of night,
the brighter are its powerful flames,
further, they cast a tinted glow
on Houses, Temples, or other buildings,
and even in the water create a frightening view.
left-middleOn painting fire, with its glow, in dark night.

32. Those who depict with their colors
raging Vulcan, such a horrific misery,
are rulers in the realm of Art.
For according to the diet or the material
which he feeds his impetuous flames,
difficult to tame, flying up to the sky,
they also take on colors:
red, purple, blue, or a shade of green.
left-middleThat Art is painting fire well.
left-middleThat flames have an appearance based on the material that feeds it

33. Not only flames, but also smoke
fills the sky with various colors;
indeed, they resemble the dreadful vapors
of the Styx, with many hideous phantoms,
Hydra, and Cerberus, ranting and roaring:
Thus Painters should pay attention here,
to represent a fire in a terrifying way,
or to stoke the flames of the Poets’ Hell.
left-middleThat not only flames but also smoke are of different colors.

34. Candlelight, not so common a thing,
is difficult to depict with art.
The best effect is to pose, in the foreground,
a figure in shadow from head to toe,
and let the light scarcely touch
the outline of the nude body, the hair or the clothing.
The light must be the center or the starting point
